result.adr_address: 192-a Sadova St, 35, Kyiv, Ukraine, 02000
result.name: Hostʹovyy Budynok Osokorky

reviews.text: This hostel is ideal for a maximum of one night. Inexpensive, cozy, in an incredibly beautiful area and close to the metro. Spent 10 nights here and the only minus that spoils everything is dirty water with the smell of rust. This smell remains on your body and hair throughout the day. I saw negative reviews about the water, but I hoped that I would be lucky. The shower is simply orange. My nails turned yellow for the first time in my life, and the white things I washed in this water also turned yellow, and even the brush for cleaning my face. But I am satisfied with the staff and attitude. Therefore, I recommend this hostel for no more than 1 night

three days before check-in, they wrote a letter through booking asking if I confirm the reservation. I didn't go to the booking and I don't use e-mail. I saw this message the evening before check-in and replied that everything is according to plan. instead, in the morning, on the day of check-in, I received a message that my reservation was canceled because I did not confirm it. however, no one called me to ask if I was confirming the reservation. not irresponsible. I had to look for another place to live.

It is clear that the owners are trying, because... For such a budget I couldn’t find anything that would be normal, even hostels are getting more and more expensive, but here the stay is homely - the rooms are cozy, they installed new entrance doors and made parking for cars, well done, I recommend it.
I liked the price-quality ratio - for such a price you won't find anything normal in Kyiv, and here it is located near the metro and good conditions - this is a rare phenomenon. I recommend!

Not the first time I stay in this Guest House. Everything is always on top. The most important thing for me is that I can be accommodated in this Guest House both at 5 in the morning (without extra charge) and at 2 in the morning. It's always cozy here, the staff are friendly and you feel like you're at home. In total, there are two bathrooms and one kitchen for five rooms. The kitchen is fully equipped to the smallest detail. Refrigerator, microwave, electric kettle, electric stove, as well as all the necessary dishes - all this is available for free use. That is, you can stay for one night or for several. Communicate with people who have been living there for 2 years. From this, we can immediately conclude that living in the Osokorka Guest House is quite comfortable. It is very important, if you are staying with children for several days, that you can prepare the usual food for yourself and the child. The house itself is quite cute. Always quiet, clean. The owners care about the beauty around. For example, this time from an ordinary alley, they made incredible beauty. From the repair of the road (although it is not theirs personally, there are still buildings along the street) to huge flower pots on the edge of the road, which looks very nice.
Upon check-in, slippers, gel and soap are given for FREE! I have been to many places, so I have something to compare it with. The rooms are spacious. Each of them has a double bed. There are rooms with a terrace, some with a balcony. Some rooms have a TV. Always fresh bedding and towels. It's all very convenient, because you don't need to take all your luggage with you. There is a lovely courtyard where you can park your car, again FREE. The prices here are extremely low for so many services. Moreover, after the start of the war, they even decreased, and if you stay for more than 3 nights, there are discounts.
I often travel on business and only stay here. I recommend Osokorka Guest House, you won't regret it.
